div.div: Πείσανδρος : Pisander.—(1) a Trojan, son of Antimachus, slain by Agamemnon, Il. 11.122, 143.—(2) a Trojan, slain by Menelāus, Il. 13.601 -619.—(3) a Greek, son of Maemalus, a chief of the Myrmidons, Il. 16.193.—(4) a suitor of Penelope, son of Polyctor, slain by Philoetius, Od. 18.299, Od. 22.268.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
